formalpara.title: Figure 4. Coverage of genes by protein families
formalpara.para: The genes are sorted for maximum non-redundancy so that a gene falling into both a large and a small family is assigned to the small family; the results are then listed from the most common to the most uncommon families. Both InterPro and NCBI KOG/TWOG/LSE families cover significant numbers of genes, but the latter are more extensive.
